org.dudss.nodeshot.terrain

Class Chunks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dudss.nodeshot.terrain.Chunks

  • public class Chunks
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages terrain and corruption generation, updating, optimising and rendering. Both terrain and corruption are rendered as direct OpenGL draw calls with their own vertex and index buffers that get uploaded to the GPU. They are also rendered using custom GLSL shaders.
    See Also:
    Shaders#corruptionShader} and {@link Shaders#terrainShader}.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create()
        Initialises chunks, sections and camera culling utilities.

      • updateChunk

        public void updateChunk(Chunk ch)
        Sends a single logic update to a Chunk.
        Parameters:
        ch - The Chunk.

      • updateView

        public void updateView(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera cam)
        Updates section camera culling and updates sections that got into the camera view and aren't updated yet. This method has a inbuilt polling feature that prevents unnecessary view updates. The rate is defined by pollRate.
        Parameters:
        cam - The main game camera

      • updateSectionMesh

        public void updateSectionMesh(Section s,
                              boolean corr,
                              int level)
        Updates terrain or corruption meshes of the section, if corr == true, corruption mesh of a selected layer will be updated If layer == -1, all corruption meshes of the section will be updated
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section
        corr - Whether a terrain or corruption mesh should be updated
        level - Which corruption level should be updated

      • updateAllSectionMeshes

        public void updateAllSectionMeshes(boolean corr,
                                   int level)
        Updates terrain or corruption meshes of all the sections in main camera view, if corr == true, corruption mesh of a selected layer will be updated If layer == -1, all corruption meshes of the section will be updated
        Parameters:
        corr - Whether a terrain or corruption mesh should be updated
        level - Which corruption level should be updated

      • updateAllChunks

        public void updateAllChunks()

      • drawTerrain

        public void drawTerrain()

      • drawCorruption

        public void drawCorruption(int layer)

      • generateMesh

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh generateMesh(Section s,
                                                   boolean corr,
                                                   int level)
        Generates and initializes a terrain or a corruption mesh. Should be only called once and the initialized mesh than can get updated using the the generateMeshVertexData(Section, boolean, int) method.
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section.
        corr - Whether a terrain or a corruption mesh should be generated
        level - The layer of the corruption mesh (In case of corruption mesh generation)
        Returns:
        Returns the generated Mesh object

      • generateMeshVertexData

        public MeshVertexData generateMeshVertexData(Section s,
                                             boolean corr,
                                             int level)
        Returns an updated MeshVertexData object used to update the Section meshes.
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section.
        corr - Whether a terrain or a corruption mesh should be generated
        level - The layer of the corruption mesh (In case of corruption mesh generation)
        Returns:
        Updated MeshVertexData object.

      • generateVertexArrays

        private MeshVertexData generateVertexArrays(Section s,
                                            boolean corr,
                                            int level,
                                            int numberOfRectangles,
                                            int numberOfVertices)
        Generates the vertices and indices arrays for a Mesh with 6 vertex attributes
        Parameters:
        s - The assigned section.
        corr - Whether a terrain or a corruption mesh should b e generated
        level - The layer of the corruption mesh (In case of corruption mesh generation)
        numberOfRectangles - Number of rectangles in the vertex array
        numberOfVertices - Number of vertices in the vertex array
        Returns:
        Updated MeshVertexData object.

      • setValuesInArrayForVertex

        private void setValuesInArrayForVertex(float[] vertices,
                                       float u,
                                       float v,
                                       float tu,
                                       float tv,
                                       float x,
                                       float y,
                                       float c,
                                       float shade,
                                       int rectangleOffsetInArray,
                                       int vertexNumberInRect)
        Method that populates the mesh vertex array (OpenGL VBO)
        Parameters:
        vertices - The array that is being modified
        u - U texture1 coordinate
        v - V texture1 coordinate
        tu - U texture2 coordinate
        tv - V texture2 coordinate
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        c - The packed color that can be used with shaders
        shade - A special shade attribute represented as "a_shade" in shaders and which is used to tint corruption mesh tiles
        rectangeOffsetInArray - Index of the current position in the array
        vertexNumberInRect - Rectangle (tile) vertex which attributes are being set

        public void generateSections()

      • generateAll

        public TextureContainer generateAll()
        Generates the terrain relief and ores.
        Returns:
        Returns a TextureContainer that holds gray-scale pixmaps of generated maps.
        Textures are in the following order: 1. terrain height map, 2. coal map, 3. iron map
